title: MongoDB Installation & Setup
subject: MongoDB
theory: To use MongoDB locally, you typically install the Community Edition. It acts as a server (daemon) listening on port 27017. MongoDB Compass is a GUI for easy interaction.

common_mistakes.correction: Default data path is C:\data\db (Windows) or /data/db (Linux/Mac). Create it manually if needed.
common_mistakes.example: Error: NonExistentPath: Data directory C:\data\db\ not found.

interview_questions.question: What is 'mongod'?
interview_questions.answer: It is the primary daemon process for the MongoDB system. It handles data requests, manages data access, and performs background management operations.

summary: A proper installation ensures your database server runs reliably on your local machine.
